name: Exto
description:
A game about the process of ordinary human beings becoming god.

When Prometheus brought fire to humans, other gods did not deliberately stop the fire. Because they were afraid of his ability and no one knew what his actions would bring.

The story of the game begins with a very personal little and gradually expands. The worldview is from modern to fantasy.

Scientifically, God explains the existence of beings, and you can see from basic mathematics/science to university-level mathematics in certain areas.

The big frame of the story tells the process of Exto becoming a god.

However, if you look at the story in the game, it can be interpreted differently depending on the player's age.

The focus was on sacrificing among the stories of the birth of heroes from all over the world. I reinterpreted Greek and Roman mythology in my own way and solved it by adding imagination to existing theology-related studies.

This game has a total of four episodes.

It's an offline game as a single play.

- Part 1 adventure with stories of the game.

There is a main story and you can follow it.

There are 163 creatures in total and you can talk to them.

There are 75 maps and walk around and talk.

Enjoying mini quests.

You can enter the inner room and look at the characters' inner feelings.

There are 2 kinds of ending, and the content does not change even if you play it repeatedly.

Shortest play time: 1 hour or less (if finished without seeing any text at all and never failed)

Playtime: 2 hours or so (when looking at text)

Playtime: Around 3 hours (when looking inside)

When exploring non-main areas, I expect to double the playing time.

- Part 2 is a sandbox puzzle RPG game.

You can solve 100 puzzles in your own way. Feed the monster a healing potion and the next puzzle will open.

Basically, collection, logging, and mining are the basis.

The customizing buttons allow you to stack blocks and place furniture on the map.

You can freely make your own drawings and decorate the screen.

You can make a boat and bring fish and seeds.

You can make a rocket and go to another planet.

You can make your own character by making hair, top, and pants and coloring them.

The ending is one.

- Part 3  is a story-type mini game.

There are 2 kinds of ending, and the content does not change even if you play it repeatedly.

Shortest play time: 10 minutes or less (if finished without seeing any text at all and never failed)

Playtime: Around 20 minutes (when viewed by text)

We expect a 10-minute increase in playtime during non-main regional exploration.

- Part 4 is the ending.

Repeated play does not change the content.

Shortest play time: 5 minutes or less (if no text is reported at all)

● A game created by a single developer.

● There are 250 different effects sounds.

● background sound has 100 songs.

(Piano music. Most of the sounds are 30 to 40 seconds per song. )

● Most of the  pictures are painted in Paint.

The part that goes through the entire chapter of the game

All objects that the player closes will get a color.

The characteristic part of this game is,

● Part 1 shows you the inner room system and details the characters' inner surroundings. This gives the characters a sense of liveliness.

● Part 2 is a puzzle. When a player produces an item, you will use it to solve the puzzle. Look at the puzzle in your own way.

● No battles.

★ I recommend using earphones and smartphones.

★ Data disappears when game is deleted.

❤ I added English and Japanese using a translation machine.

Find characters and hidden stories that are not written in the manual. That'll be fun, too.
